results.title: To speak or not to speak
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Raoul Servais
results.brief_description: A grim animated satire on politics and the media - man’s general lack on knowledge on one and his dependence on the other. An allegory on the dangers of political apathy demonstrating that people who lack knowledge of their political affairs are ripe for manipulation or takeover by special interests or totalitarian governments. Animated by Willy Verschelde, background by Norbert Deseyn. Non-narrated.

results.title: To Sing Our Own Song: Philippines
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World about Us: Third Eye”.
One of a series of programs in which individuals describe the developing countries in which they live. Josae Diokno, former Secretary of Justice in the Philippines’ government is a victim of his outspoken views. A leading intellectual figure of dissent in the Third World, he spent two years in jail for hostile criticism of the martial law imposed by President Marcos.

results.title: To save her soul
results.brief_description: A moral tale of a choir singer and an enthusiastic admirer from the clergy who is intent on saving the young singer’s soul. Cast includes Mary Pickford, Arthur V. Johnson, Caroline Harris, Mack Sennett. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: To meet a challenge
results.brief_description: Aluminium is one of the most sought after metals in use today. All the stages in the manufacture of aluminium, from the mining of bauxite, the raw material, to the pressing of the metal into its final shape is depicted. As well as its mines in the Darling Ranges, Alcoa also owns refineries at places such as Kwinana and has ready access to ports to speed the finished product on its way, whether it be destined for Japan or the United States.

results.title: To live in darkness
results.brief_description: Shows the hazards facing workmen who, through carelessness or deliberate neglect, fail to wear goggles when these are necessary for safety. Deals with factory conditions.

results.title: To live and learn
results.brief_description: A film about London schools and school-children, showing the work of infant, junior and secondary schools. The film brings out the development of the children’s own personalities as well as showing teaching methods, and illustrates the wide variety of opportunities in London’s grammar and other secondary schools. Interviews with head teachers and parents are included.

results.title: To learn day by day
results.creator_credit: Video Media Production and Alex Jaye
results.brief_description: Offers advice to child care providers on appropriate strategies to facilitate the learning of basic concepts such as big, round, etc. as well as number games and colours. Provides a strategy which involves starting with concepts and moving on to comparisons. Appropriate for professional Development and personal development (Home Economics) at VCE level.
